00044 void CVideoDriver::resetSettings() {
00045  // Default values
00046  m_maxwidth = 0;
00047  showfps=true;
00048  Mode=0;
00049 #if defined(WIZ) || defined(GP2X) || defined(DINGOO)
00050  m_Resolution.width=320;
00051  m_Resolution.height=240;
00052 #if defined(GP2X)
00053  m_Resolution.depth=32;
00054 #else
00055  m_Resolution.depth=16;
00056 #endif
00057  Fullscreen=true;
00058 #else
00059  m_Resolution.width=320;
00060  m_Resolution.height=200;
00061  m_Resolution.depth=32;
00062  Fullscreen=false;
00063 #endif
00064  m_ScaleXFilter=1;
00065  Zoom=1;
00066  m_targetfps = 60; // Enable automatic frameskipping by default at 30
00067  
00068 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00069  m_opengl_filter = GL_NEAREST;
00070  mp_OpenGL = NULL;
00071 #endif
00072 
00073  m_opengl = false; // Must stay optional for better compatibility
00074 
00075  m_aspect_correction = true;
00076 
00077  screenrect.x=0;
00078  screenrect.y=0;
00079  screenrect.h=0;
00080  screenrect.w=0;
00081 
00082  // Default camera settings
00083  m_CameraBounds.left = 140;
00084  m_CameraBounds.up = 50;
00085  m_CameraBounds.right = 180;
00086  m_CameraBounds.down = 130;
00087  m_CameraBounds.speed = 5;
00088 
00089  ScrollSurface=NULL;       // 512x512 scroll buffer
00090  FGLayerSurface=NULL;       // Scroll buffer for Messages
00091  BlitSurface=NULL;
00092 
00093  m_special_fx = true;
00094 
00095  mp_sbufferx = mp_sbuffery = NULL;
00096 
00097  if(SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_VIDEO | SDL_INIT_TIMER | SDL_INIT_AUDIO) < 0)
00098  {
00099   g_pLogFile->textOut(RED,"Could not initialize SDL: %s<br>", SDL_GetError());
00100  }
00101  else
00102  {
00103   g_pLogFile->textOut(GREEN,"SDL was successfully initialized!<br>");
00104   m_maxwidth = SDL_GetVideoInfo()->current_w;
00105  }
00106 
00107 #if defined(TARGET_OS_IPHONE) || defined(TARGET_IPHONE_SIMULATOR)
00108  m_opengl = true;
00109  Zoom = 1;
00110  m_ScaleXFilter = 1;
00111  m_targetfps = 30;
00112  m_aspect_correction = false;
00113 #endif
00114 
00115  initResolutionList();
00116 
00117  // take the first default resolution. It might be changed if there is a config file already created
00118  setMode(m_Resolutionlist.front().width, m_Resolutionlist.front().height, m_Resolutionlist.front().depth);
00119 }
00120 
00121 // initResolutionList() reads the local list of available resolution.
00122 // This function can only be called internally
00123 void CVideoDriver::initResolutionList()
00124 {
00125  st_resolution resolution;
00126  m_Resolutionlist.clear();
00127  m_value = 1;
00128 
00129 #if defined(TARGET_OS_IPHONE) || defined(TARGET_IPHONE_SIMULATOR)
00130  m_Resolution.width = 320; //  320;
00131  m_Resolution.height = 200; //  480;
00132  m_Resolution.depth = 32;
00133  m_Resolutionlist.clear();
00134  m_Resolutionlist.push_back(m_Resolution);
00135 #else
00136  char buf[256];
00137 
00138  std::ifstream ResolutionFile; OpenGameFileR(ResolutionFile, "resolutions.cfg");
00139  if(!ResolutionFile)
00140  {
00141   g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Warning: resolutions.cfg could not be read! Maybe your files weren't extracted correctly!<br>");
00142   g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Using default resolution<br>");
00143  }
00144  else
00145  {
00146   while(!ResolutionFile.eof())
00147   {
00148    ResolutionFile.getline(buf,256);
00149 
00150    if(sscanf(buf,"%ix%ix%i", &resolution.width, &resolution.height, &resolution.depth) >= 2)
00151 
00152    // Now check if it's possible to use this resolution
00153    checkResolution( resolution, SDL_FULLSCREEN );
00154   }
00155   ResolutionFile.close();
00156 
00157   if(!Fullscreen)
00158   {
00159    int e = 1;
00160    resolution.width = 320;
00161    resolution.height = 200;
00162 #ifdef WIZ
00163    resolution.depth = 16;
00164 #else
00165    resolution.depth = 32;
00166 #endif
00167 
00168    while(resolution.width < m_maxwidth)
00169    {
00170     resolution.width = 320 * e;
00171     resolution.height = 200 * e;
00172 
00173     // Now check if it's possible to use this resolution
00174     checkResolution( resolution, 0 );
00175 
00176     e++;
00177    }
00178   }
00179  }
00180 #endif 
00181 
00182  if(m_Resolutionlist.empty()) {
00183   resolution.width = 320;
00184   resolution.height = 200;
00185   resolution.depth = 32;
00186   m_Resolutionlist.push_back(resolution);
00187  }
00188 
00189  m_Resolution_pos = m_Resolutionlist.begin();
00190 }
00191 
00192 void CVideoDriver::checkResolution( st_resolution& resolution, int flags )
00193 {
00194   resolution.depth = SDL_VideoModeOK( resolution.width, resolution.height, resolution.depth, flags );
00195 
00196   if(resolution.depth)
00197   {
00198    std::list<st_resolution> :: iterator i;
00199    for( i = m_Resolutionlist.begin() ; i != m_Resolutionlist.end() ; i++ )
00200    {
00201     if(i->width  == resolution.width  &&
00202        i->height == resolution.height &&
00203        i->depth  == resolution.depth) break;
00204    }
00205 
00206    if(i == m_Resolutionlist.end())
00207    {
00208 #ifdef DEBUG
00209     printf( "%ix%ix%i %X added\n", resolution.width, resolution.height, resolution.depth, flags );
00210 #endif
00211     resolution.value = m_value;
00212     m_Resolutionlist.push_back(resolution);
00213     m_value++; 
00214    }
00215   }
00216 }
00217 
00218 st_resolution CVideoDriver::setResolution(int value)
00219 { 
00220  std::list<st_resolution> :: iterator i;
00221    for( i = g_pVideoDriver->m_Resolutionlist.begin() ; i != g_pVideoDriver->m_Resolutionlist.end() ; i++ )
00222    {
00223     if(i->value  == value)
00224     {
00225      m_Resolution_pos = i;
00226      break;
00227     }
00228    }
00229 
00230  return *m_Resolution_pos;
00231 }
00232 
00233 // Sets the resolution. you can pass st_resolution-structure or the variables separated.
00234 void CVideoDriver::setMode(st_resolution Resolution)
00235 {
00236  setMode(Resolution.width, Resolution.height, Resolution.depth);
00237 }

00239 void CVideoDriver::setSpecialFXMode(bool SpecialFX)
00240 { m_special_fx = SpecialFX; }
00241 
00242 void CVideoDriver::setMode(int width, int height,int depth)
00243 {
00244  m_Resolution.width = width;
00245  m_Resolution.height = height;
00246  m_Resolution.depth = depth;
00247 
00248  // TODO: Cycle through the list until the matching resolution is matched. If it doesn't exist
00249  // add it;
00250  for(m_Resolution_pos = m_Resolutionlist.begin() ; m_Resolution_pos != m_Resolutionlist.end() ; m_Resolution_pos++)
00251   if( m_Resolution_pos->width == width )
00252    if( m_Resolution_pos->height == height )
00253     if( m_Resolution_pos->depth == depth )
00254      break;
00255 
00256  if(m_Resolution_pos == m_Resolutionlist.end())
00257  {
00258   m_Resolutionlist.push_back(m_Resolution);
00259   m_Resolution_pos--;
00260  }
00261 }
00262 
00263 void CVideoDriver::stop(void)
00264 {
00265     if(m_blitsurface_alloc && BlitSurface)
00266     {
00267         SDL_FreeSurface(BlitSurface);
00268         g_pLogFile->textOut("freed BlitSurface<br>");
00269         BlitSurface=NULL;
00270     }
00271     if(FGLayerSurface)
00272     {
00273         SDL_FreeSurface(FGLayerSurface);
00274         g_pLogFile->textOut("freed FGLayerSurface<br>");
00275         FGLayerSurface=NULL;
00276     }
00277     if(ScrollSurface && (ScrollSurface->map != NULL))
00278     {
00279         SDL_FreeSurface(ScrollSurface);
00280         g_pLogFile->textOut("freed ScrollSurface<br>");
00281         ScrollSurface=NULL;
00282     }
00283     if(FXSurface)
00284     {
00285         SDL_FreeSurface(FXSurface);
00286         g_pLogFile->textOut("freed FXSurface<br>");
00287         FXSurface=NULL;
00288     }
00289 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00290  if(mp_OpenGL) { delete mp_OpenGL; mp_OpenGL = NULL; }
00291 #endif
00292  g_pLogFile->textOut(GREEN, "VideoDriver Stopped<br>\n");
00293 }

00296 extern "C" void iPhoneRotateScreen();

00299 bool CVideoDriver::start(void)
00300 { 
00301  bool retval = false;
00302 
00303  std::string caption = "Commander Genius (CKP)";
00304  SDL_WM_SetCaption(caption.c_str(), caption.c_str());
00305  // When the program is through executing, call SDL_Quit
00306  atexit(SDL_Quit);
00307 
00308  if(!applyMode())
00309  {
00310   g_pLogFile->textOut(RED,"VideoDriver: Error applying mode! Your Videocard doesn't seem to work on CKP<br>");
00311   g_pLogFile->textOut(RED,"Check, if you have the most recent drivers installed!<br>");
00312   return false;
00313  }
00314 
00315  retval = createSurfaces();
00316  initOpenGL();
00317 
00318 #if defined(TARGET_OS_IPHONE) || defined(TARGET_IPHONE_SIMULATOR)
00319  iPhoneRotateScreen();
00320 #endif
00321  
00322  return retval;
00323 }
00324 
00325 bool CVideoDriver::initOpenGL()
00326 {
00327 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00328  if(m_opengl) // If OpenGL could be set, initialize the matrices
00329  {
00330   mp_OpenGL = new COpenGL(m_Resolution.width, m_Resolution.height, m_Resolution.depth,
00331          m_ScaleXFilter, game_resolution_rect);
00332 
00333   if(!(mp_OpenGL->initGL(m_opengl_filter)))
00334   {
00335    delete mp_OpenGL;
00336    mp_OpenGL = NULL;
00337    m_opengl = false;
00338    applyMode();
00339   }
00340   else
00341   {
00342    mp_OpenGL->setBlitSurface(BlitSurface);
00343   }
00344  }
00345 #endif
00346 
00347  return m_opengl;
00348 }
00349 
00350 bool CVideoDriver::applyMode()
00351 {
00352 #if defined(TARGET_OS_IPHONE) || defined(TARGET_IPHONE_SIMULATOR)
00353  // Force the default settings on iPhone.
00354  // There is no reason yet to play with it, most likely other settings will
00355  // either not work, will crash or will just be totally screwed up.
00356  resetSettings();
00357 #endif
00358  
00359  // Check if some zoom/filter modes are illogical
00360  // TODO: Make this call better to understand
00361  // It must be able to change the resolution, and if it fails, roll back.
00362 
00363  // bool rollback=false;
00364  //if(!checkMode())
00365  // rollback = true;
00366 
00367  if( (Zoom == 3 && m_ScaleXFilter == 1) && !m_opengl )
00368   Zoom = 2;
00369 
00370  m_Resolution = *m_Resolution_pos;
00371 
00372  // Setup mode depends on some systems.
00373 #if defined(WIZ) || defined(DINGOO)
00374     Mode = SDL_SWSURFACE;
00375 #elif defined(GP2X)
00376     Mode = SDL_DOUBLEBUF | SDL_HWSURFACE;
00377 #else
00378  // Support for doublebuffering
00379  Mode = SDL_DOUBLEBUF | SDL_HWPALETTE | SDL_HWSURFACE;
00380 #endif
00381 
00382  // Enable OpenGL
00383 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00384  if(m_opengl)
00385  {
00386   SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_ACCELERATED_VISUAL, 1);
00387  #if SDL_VERSION_ATLEAST(1, 3, 0)
00388  #else
00389   // TODO: unknown in SDL 1.3. important?
00390   // TODO: Yeah, it is in SDL 1.2 for some systems!!!
00391   SDL_GL_SetAttribute(SDL_GL_SWAP_CONTROL, 1);
00392  #endif
00393 
00394   Mode |= SDL_OPENGL;
00395  }
00396 #endif
00397 
00398  // This is the default game resolution
00399     game_resolution_rect.w = 320;
00400  game_resolution_rect.h = 200;
00401 
00402  // Here we check, if we can enhance the screen-resolution and do it if yes
00403  game_resolution_rect = adaptGameResolution();
00404 
00405  // Now we decide if it will be fullscreen or windowed mode.
00406  if(Fullscreen)
00407   Mode |= SDL_FULLSCREEN;
00408 
00409  // Before the resolution is set, check, if the zoom factor is too high!
00410  while(((m_Resolution.width/game_resolution_rect.w) < Zoom || (m_Resolution.height/game_resolution_rect.h) < Zoom) && (Zoom > 1))
00411   Zoom--;
00412 
00413     // Center the screen!
00414     blitrect.x = 0;
00415     blitrect.y = 0;
00416  screenrect.w = blitrect.w = game_resolution_rect.w*Zoom;
00417  screenrect.h = blitrect.h = game_resolution_rect.h*Zoom;
00418  screenrect.x = (m_Resolution.width-screenrect.w)/2;
00419  screenrect.y = (m_Resolution.height-screenrect.h)/2;
00420 
00421  // And leave the rest to SDL!
00422  screen = SDL_SetVideoMode(m_Resolution.width,m_Resolution.height,m_Resolution.depth,Mode);
00423 
00424  if(!screen)
00425  {
00426   g_pLogFile->textOut(RED,"VidDrv_Start(): Couldn't create a SDL surface: %s<br>", SDL_GetError());
00427   return false;
00428  }
00429 
00430  // Now SDL will tell if the bpp works or changes it, if not supported.
00431  // this value is updated here!
00432  m_Resolution.depth = screen->format->BitsPerPixel;
00433 
00434  // If Fullscreen hide the mouse cursor.
00435  // Anyway, it just can point but does not interact yet
00436   SDL_ShowCursor(!Fullscreen);
00437 
00438   m_dst_slice = m_Resolution.width*screen->format->BytesPerPixel;
00439   m_src_slice = game_resolution_rect.w*screen->format->BytesPerPixel;
00440 
00441  return true;
00442 }
00443 
00444 // This function adapts the gamescreenspace to the monitor format.
00445 // 16:9, 16:10, 4:3, everthing is supported as far it fits to the height!
00446 SDL_Rect CVideoDriver::adaptGameResolution()
00447 {
00448  float scalefactor;
00449  SDL_Rect Gamerect;
00450 
00451  Gamerect = game_resolution_rect;
00452  scalefactor = ((float)m_Resolution.width) / ((float)Gamerect.w);
00453  Gamerect.h = (int)( ((float)m_Resolution.height) / scalefactor );
00454 
00455  return Gamerect;
00456 }
00457 
00458 void CVideoDriver::setFilter(short value) { m_ScaleXFilter = value; } // 1 means no filter of course
00459 
00460 void CVideoDriver::setZoom(short value) { Zoom = value; }
00461 
00462 bool CVideoDriver::createSurfaces()
00463 {
00464  // This function creates the surfaces which are needed for the game.
00465     ScrollSurface = createSurface( "ScrollSurface", true,
00466           512,
00467           512,
00468           m_Resolution.depth,
00469           Mode, screen->format );
00470 
00471     if (m_Resolution.width == game_resolution_rect.w && !m_opengl)
00472     {
00473      g_pLogFile->textOut("Blitsurface = Screen<br>");
00474      BlitSurface = screen;
00475      m_blitsurface_alloc = false;
00476     }
00477     else
00478     {
00479 
00480      g_pLogFile->textOut("Blitsurface = creatergbsurfacefrom<br>");
00481 
00482 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00483      if(m_opengl)
00484      {
00485             BlitSurface = createSurface( "BlitSurface", true,
00486                 getPowerOfTwo(game_resolution_rect.w),
00487                 getPowerOfTwo(game_resolution_rect.h),
00488              m_Resolution.depth,
00489              Mode, screen->format );
00490      }
00491      else
00492 #endif
00493      {
00494       BlitSurface = createSurface( "BlitSurface", true,
00495          game_resolution_rect.w,
00496          game_resolution_rect.h,
00497          m_Resolution.depth,
00498          Mode, screen->format );
00499      }
00500         m_blitsurface_alloc = true;
00501     }
00502     VRAMPtr = (unsigned char*)screen->pixels +
00503  screenrect.y*screen->pitch + (screenrect.x*m_Resolution.depth>>3);
00504 
00505     // Some surfaces could get 320x240 and the screenspace is extended.
00506     // The video class must be changed for any further resolutions
00507     game_resolution_rect.x = 0; game_resolution_rect.y = 0;
00508 
00509 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00510  if(m_opengl && m_ScaleXFilter == 1)
00511  {
00512   FGLayerSurface = createSurface( "FGLayerSurface", true,
00513       getPowerOfTwo(game_resolution_rect.w),
00514       getPowerOfTwo(game_resolution_rect.h),
00515            m_Resolution.depth,
00516            Mode, screen->format );
00517  }
00518  else
00519 #endif
00520  {
00521   FGLayerSurface = createSurface( "FGLayerSurface", false,
00522            game_resolution_rect.w,
00523            game_resolution_rect.h,
00524            m_Resolution.depth,
00525            Mode, screen->format );
00526 
00527   SDL_SetColorKey( FGLayerSurface, SDL_SRCCOLORKEY,
00528       SDL_MapRGB(FGLayerSurface->format, 0, 0xFF, 0xFE) );
00529 
00530  }
00531 
00532  //Set surface alpha
00533  SDL_SetAlpha( FGLayerSurface, SDL_SRCALPHA, 225 );
00534 
00535 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00536  if(m_opengl && m_ScaleXFilter == 1)
00537  {
00538   FXSurface = createSurface( "FXSurface", true,
00539     getPowerOfTwo(game_resolution_rect.w),
00540     getPowerOfTwo(game_resolution_rect.h),
00541          m_Resolution.depth,
00542          Mode, screen->format );
00543  }
00544  else
00545 #endif
00546  {
00547      FXSurface = createSurface( "FXSurface", false,
00548            game_resolution_rect.w,
00549            game_resolution_rect.h,
00550           m_Resolution.depth,
00551           Mode, screen->format );
00552  }
00553 
00554  g_pGfxEngine->Palette.setFXSurface( FXSurface );
00555 
00556  return true;
00557 }
00558 
00559 SDL_Surface* CVideoDriver::createSurface( std::string name, bool alpha, int width, int height, int bpp, int mode, SDL_PixelFormat* format )
00560 {
00561  SDL_Surface *temporary, *optimized;
00562 
00563  temporary = SDL_CreateRGBSurface( mode, width, height, bpp, format->Rmask, format->Gmask, format->Bmask, format->Amask);
00564  if (alpha && bpp==32) {
00565   optimized = SDL_DisplayFormatAlpha( temporary );
00566  } else {
00567   optimized = SDL_DisplayFormat( temporary );
00568  }
00569  SDL_FreeSurface(temporary);
00570  if (!optimized)
00571  {
00572   g_pLogFile->textOut(RED,"VideoDriver: Couldn't create surface:" + name +"<br>");
00573   return NULL;
00574  }
00575  bpp = optimized->format->BitsPerPixel;
00576  return optimized;
00577 }
00578 
00579 // defines the scroll-buffer that is used for blitScrollSurface(). It's normally passed by a CMap Object
00580 // It might have when a level-map is loaded.
00581 void CVideoDriver::setScrollBuffer(Sint16 *pbufx, Sint16 *pbufy)
00582 {
00583  mp_sbufferx = pbufx;
00584  mp_sbuffery = pbufy;
00585 }
00586 
00587 void CVideoDriver::blitScrollSurface() // This is only for tiles
00588             // The name should be changed
00589 {
00590  SDL_Rect srcrect;
00591  SDL_Rect dstrect;
00592  Sint16 sbufferx, sbuffery;
00593  char wraphoz, wrapvrt;
00594  int save_dstx, save_dstw, save_srcx, save_srcw;
00595 
00596  dstrect.x = 0; dstrect.y = 0;
00597 
00598  srcrect.x = sbufferx = *mp_sbufferx;
00599  srcrect.y = sbuffery = *mp_sbuffery;
00600 
00601  dstrect.w = game_resolution_rect.w-sbufferx;
00602  dstrect.h = game_resolution_rect.h-sbuffery;
00603 
00604  if (sbufferx > (Uint16)(512-game_resolution_rect.w))
00605  { // need to wrap right side
00606   srcrect.w = (512-sbufferx);
00607   wraphoz = 1;
00608  }
00609  else
00610  { // single blit for whole horizontal copy
00611   srcrect.w = game_resolution_rect.w;
00612   wraphoz = 0;
00613  }
00614 
00615  if (sbuffery > (Uint16)(512-game_resolution_rect.h))
00616  { // need to wrap on bottom
00617   srcrect.h = (512-sbuffery);
00618   wrapvrt = 1;
00619  }
00620  else
00621  { // single blit for whole bottom copy
00622   srcrect.h = game_resolution_rect.h;
00623   wrapvrt = 0;
00624  }
00625 
00626  SDL_BlitSurface(ScrollSurface, &srcrect, BlitSurface, &dstrect);
00627 
00628  if (wraphoz && wrapvrt)
00629  {
00630   // first do same thing we do for wraphoz
00631   save_dstx = dstrect.x;
00632   save_dstw = dstrect.w;
00633   save_srcx = srcrect.x;
00634   save_srcw = srcrect.w;
00635   dstrect.x = srcrect.w;
00636   dstrect.w = game_resolution_rect.w - dstrect.x;
00637   srcrect.x = 0;
00638   srcrect.w = (game_resolution_rect.w - srcrect.w);
00639   SDL_BlitSurface(ScrollSurface, &srcrect, BlitSurface, &dstrect);
00640 
00641   // now repeat for the bottom
00642   // (lower-right square)
00643   dstrect.y = srcrect.h;
00644   dstrect.h = game_resolution_rect.h - dstrect.y;
00645   srcrect.y = 0;
00646   srcrect.h = (game_resolution_rect.h - srcrect.h);
00647   SDL_BlitSurface(ScrollSurface, &srcrect, BlitSurface, &dstrect);
00648   // (lower-left square)
00649   dstrect.x = save_dstx;
00650   dstrect.w = save_dstw;
00651   srcrect.x = save_srcx;
00652   srcrect.w = save_srcw;
00653   SDL_BlitSurface(ScrollSurface, &srcrect, BlitSurface, &dstrect);
00654  }
00655  else if (wraphoz)
00656  {
00657   dstrect.x = srcrect.w;
00658   dstrect.w = game_resolution_rect.w - dstrect.x;
00659   srcrect.x = 0;
00660   srcrect.w = game_resolution_rect.w - srcrect.w;
00661   SDL_BlitSurface(ScrollSurface, &srcrect, BlitSurface, &dstrect);
00662  }
00663  else if (wrapvrt)
00664  {
00665   dstrect.y = srcrect.h;
00666   dstrect.h = game_resolution_rect.h - dstrect.y;
00667   srcrect.y = 0;
00668   srcrect.h = (game_resolution_rect.h - srcrect.h);
00669   SDL_BlitSurface(ScrollSurface, &srcrect, BlitSurface, &dstrect);
00670  }
00671 
00672  drawConsoleMessages();
00673 }
00674 
00675 void CVideoDriver::collectSurfaces()
00676 {
00677 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00678  if(m_opengl && m_ScaleXFilter == 1)
00679  {
00680   // TODO: Create a solid concept for rendering more textures instead of just one that is binded
00681   // to BlitSurface. It's not that easy, because doing that and using scaleX will mean, that you
00682   // to scaleX multiple times. So COpenGL must have separate cases. With or without ScaleX.
00683   // It's might only be faster if scaleX is never used in that TODO-case
00684 
00685   mp_OpenGL->setFGSurface(FGLayerSurface);
00686 
00687   if(getPerSurfaceAlpha(FXSurface))
00688    mp_OpenGL->setFXSurface(FXSurface);
00689   else
00690    mp_OpenGL->setFXSurface(NULL);
00691  }
00692  else
00693 #endif
00694  {
00695   SDL_BlitSurface(FGLayerSurface, NULL, BlitSurface, NULL);
00696 
00697   if(getPerSurfaceAlpha(FXSurface))
00698    SDL_BlitSurface(FXSurface, NULL, BlitSurface, NULL);
00699  }
00700 }
00701 
00702 void CVideoDriver::updateScreen()
00703 {
00704 
00705 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00706  if(m_opengl)
00707  {
00708   mp_OpenGL->render();
00709 
00710   // Flush the FG-Layer
00711   if(m_ScaleXFilter == 1)
00712    SDL_FillRect(FGLayerSurface, NULL, SDL_MapRGBA(FGLayerSurface->format, 0, 0, 0, 0));
00713   else
00714    SDL_FillRect(FGLayerSurface, NULL, SDL_MapRGB(FGLayerSurface->format, 0, 0xFF, 0xFE));
00715  }
00716  else // No OpenGL but Software Rendering
00717  {
00718 #endif
00719   // if we're doing zoom then we have copied the scroll buffer into
00720   // another offscreen buffer, and must now stretchblit it to the screen
00721   if (Zoom == 1 && m_Resolution.width != game_resolution_rect.w )
00722   {
00723    LockSurface(BlitSurface);
00724    LockSurface(screen);
00725 
00726    if(m_ScaleXFilter == 1)
00727    {
00728     SDL_Rect scrrect, dstrect;
00729     scrrect.y = 0;
00730     scrrect.x = 0;
00731     scrrect.h = game_resolution_rect.h;
00732     scrrect.w = game_resolution_rect.w;
00733     dstrect.x = (m_Resolution.width-game_resolution_rect.w)/2;
00734     dstrect.y = (m_Resolution.height-game_resolution_rect.h)/2;
00735     dstrect.w = game_resolution_rect.w;
00736     dstrect.h = game_resolution_rect.h;
00737 
00738     SDL_BlitSurface(BlitSurface, &scrrect, screen, &dstrect);
00739    }
00740    else
00741    {
00742     g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Sorry, but this filter doesn't work at that zoom mode<br>");
00743     g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Try to use a higher zoom factor. Switching to no-filter<br>");
00744     m_ScaleXFilter = 1;
00745    }
00746    UnlockSurface(screen);
00747    UnlockSurface(BlitSurface);
00748   }
00749   if (Zoom == 2)
00750   {
00751    LockSurface(BlitSurface);
00752    LockSurface(screen);
00753 
00754    if(m_ScaleXFilter == 1)
00755    {
00756     scale2xnofilter((char*)VRAMPtr, (char*)BlitSurface->pixels, screen->format->BytesPerPixel);
00757    }
00758    else if(m_ScaleXFilter == 2)
00759    {
00760     scale(m_ScaleXFilter, VRAMPtr, m_dst_slice, BlitSurface->pixels,
00761       m_src_slice, screen->format->BytesPerPixel,
00762       game_resolution_rect.w, game_resolution_rect.h);
00763    }
00764    else
00765    {
00766     g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Sorry, but this filter doesn't work at that zoom mode<br>");
00767     g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Try to use a higher zoom factor. Switching to no-filter<br>");
00768     m_ScaleXFilter = 1;
00769    }
00770 
00771    UnlockSurface(screen);
00772    UnlockSurface(BlitSurface);
00773   }
00774   else if (Zoom == 3)
00775   {
00776    LockSurface(BlitSurface);
00777    LockSurface(screen);
00778 
00779    if(m_ScaleXFilter == 1)
00780    {
00781     scale3xnofilter((char*)VRAMPtr, (char*)BlitSurface->pixels, screen->format->BytesPerPixel);
00782    }
00783    else if(m_ScaleXFilter == 2 || m_ScaleXFilter == 3)
00784    {
00785     scale(m_ScaleXFilter, VRAMPtr, m_dst_slice, BlitSurface->pixels,
00786       m_src_slice, screen->format->BytesPerPixel,
00787       game_resolution_rect.w, game_resolution_rect.h);
00788    }
00789    else
00790    {
00791     g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Sorry, but this filter doesn't work at that zoom mode<br>");
00792     g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Try to use a higher zoom factor. Switching to no-filter<br>");
00793     m_ScaleXFilter = 1;
00794    }
00795    UnlockSurface(screen);
00796    UnlockSurface(BlitSurface);
00797   }
00798   else if (Zoom == 4)
00799   {
00800    LockSurface(BlitSurface);
00801    LockSurface(screen);
00802 
00803    if(m_ScaleXFilter == 1)
00804    {
00805     scale4xnofilter((char*)VRAMPtr, (char*)BlitSurface->pixels, screen->format->BytesPerPixel);
00806    }
00807    else if(m_ScaleXFilter >= 2 && m_ScaleXFilter <= 4 )
00808    {
00809     scale(m_ScaleXFilter, VRAMPtr, m_dst_slice, BlitSurface->pixels,
00810       m_src_slice, screen->format->BytesPerPixel,
00811       game_resolution_rect.w, game_resolution_rect.h);
00812    }
00813    else
00814    {
00815     g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Sorry, but this filter doesn't work at that zoom mode<br>");
00816     g_pLogFile->textOut(PURPLE,"Try to use a higher zoom factor. Switching to no-filter<br>");
00817     m_ScaleXFilter = 1;
00818    }
00819    UnlockSurface(screen);
00820    UnlockSurface(BlitSurface);
00821   }
00822 
00823 #if defined(GP2X) || defined(WIZ)
00824   // Clear the lower 40 lines to black
00825   SDL_Rect lower = { 0, 200, 320, 40 };
00826   SDL_FillRect(screen, &lower, SDL_MapRGB(screen->format, 0, 0, 0) );
00827 #endif
00828 
00829   SDL_Flip(screen);
00830 
00831   // Flush the FG-Layer
00832   SDL_FillRect(FGLayerSurface, NULL, SDL_MapRGB(FGLayerSurface->format, 0, 0xFF, 0xFE));
00833 
00834 #ifdef USE_OPENGL
00835  }
00836 #endif
00837 }
00838 
00839 void CVideoDriver::scale2xnofilter(char *dest, char *src, short bbp)
00840 {
00841  // workaround for copying correctly stuff to the screen, so the screen is scaled normally
00842     // to 2x (without filter). This applies to 16 and 32-bit colour depth.
00843  // It uses bit shifting method for faster blit!
00844  bbp >>= 1;
00845 
00846  int i,j;
00847  for(i=0 ; i < game_resolution_rect.h ; i++)
00848  {
00849   for(j = 0; j < game_resolution_rect.w ; j++)
00850   {
00851    memcpy(dest+((j<<1)<<bbp)+(((i<<1)*m_Resolution.width)<<bbp),src+(j<<bbp)+((i*game_resolution_rect.w)<<bbp),bbp<<1);
00852    memcpy(dest+(((j<<1)+1)<<bbp)+(((i<<1)*m_Resolution.width)<<bbp),src+(j<<bbp)+((i*game_resolution_rect.w)<<bbp),bbp<<1);
00853   }
00854   memcpy(dest+(((i<<1)+1)*(m_Resolution.width<<bbp)),(dest+(i<<1)*(m_Resolution.width<<bbp)),(bbp<<2)*game_resolution_rect.w);
00855  }
00856 }
00857 
00858 void CVideoDriver::scale3xnofilter(char *dest, char *src, short bbp)
00859 {
00860  // workaround for copying correctly stuff to the screen, so the screen is scaled normally
00861     // to 2x (without filter). This applies to 16 and 32-bit colour depth.
00862  // Optimization of using bit shifting
00863  bbp >>= 1;
00864 
00865  int i,j;
00866  for(i=0 ; i < game_resolution_rect.h ; i++)
00867  {
00868   for(j = 0; j < game_resolution_rect.w ; j++)
00869   {
00870    // j*3 = (j<<1) + j
00871    memcpy(dest+(((j<<1)+j)<<bbp)+((((i<<1) + i)*m_Resolution.width)<<bbp),src+(j<<bbp)+((i*game_resolution_rect.w)<<bbp),bbp<<1);
00872    memcpy(dest+(((j<<1)+j+1)<<bbp)+((((i<<1) + i)*m_Resolution.width)<<bbp),src+(j<<bbp)+((i*game_resolution_rect.w)<<bbp),bbp<<1);
00873    memcpy(dest+(((j<<1)+j+2)<<bbp)+((((i<<1) + i)*m_Resolution.width)<<bbp),src+(j<<bbp)+((i*game_resolution_rect.w)<<bbp),bbp<<1);
00874   }
00875   memcpy(dest+((i<<1)+i+1)*(m_Resolution.width<<bbp),dest+((i<<1)+i)*(m_Resolution.width<<bbp),(3<<bbp)*game_resolution_rect.w);
00876   memcpy(dest+((i<<1)+i+2)*(m_Resolution.width<<bbp),dest+((i<<1)+i)*(m_Resolution.width<<bbp),(3<<bbp)*game_resolution_rect.w);
00877  }
00878 }
00879 
00880 void CVideoDriver::scale4xnofilter(char *dest, char *src, short bbp)
00881 {
00882  // workaround for copying correctly stuff to the screen, so the screen is scaled normally
00883     // to 2x (without filter). This applies to 16 and 32-bit colour depth.
00884  // use bit shifting method for faster blit!
00885  bbp >>= 1;
00886 
00887  char *srctemp;
00888  char *desttemp;
00889  int size;
00890 
00891  int i,j;
00892  for(i=0 ; i < game_resolution_rect.h ; i++)
00893  {
00894   for(j = 0; j < game_resolution_rect.w ; j++)
00895   {
00896    // j*4 = (j<<2)
00897    srctemp = src+((j+(i*game_resolution_rect.w))<<bbp);
00898    desttemp = dest+((4*(j+(i*m_Resolution.width)))<<bbp);
00899    memcpy(desttemp,srctemp,bbp<<1);
00900    memcpy(desttemp+(1<<bbp),srctemp,bbp<<1);
00901    memcpy(desttemp+(2<<bbp),srctemp,bbp<<1);
00902    memcpy(desttemp+(3<<bbp),srctemp,bbp<<1);
00903   }
00904   srctemp = dest+(((i<<2)*m_Resolution.width)<<bbp);
00905   desttemp = dest+((((i<<2)+1)*m_Resolution.width)<<bbp);
00906   size = game_resolution_rect.w*(bbp<<1<<2);
00907 
00908   memcpy(desttemp,srctemp,size);
00909   memcpy(desttemp+(m_Resolution.width<<bbp),srctemp,size);
00910   memcpy(desttemp+((m_Resolution.width<<bbp)<<1),srctemp,size);
00911  }
00912 }
00913 
00914 // "Console" here refers to the capability to pop up in-game messages
00915 // in the upper-left corner during game play ala Doom.
00916 void CVideoDriver::drawConsoleMessages(void)
00917 {
00918  int i;
00919  int y;
00920 
00921  if (!NumConsoleMessages) return;
00922  if (!ConsoleExpireTimer)
00923  {
00924   NumConsoleMessages--;
00925   if (!NumConsoleMessages) return;
00926   ConsoleExpireTimer = CONSOLE_EXPIRE_RATE;
00927  }
00928  else ConsoleExpireTimer--;
00929 
00930  y = CONSOLE_MESSAGE_Y;
00931  for(i=0;i<NumConsoleMessages;i++)
00932  {
00933   g_pGfxEngine->getFont(0).drawFont( FGLayerSurface, cmsg[i].msg, CONSOLE_MESSAGE_X, y, true);
00934   y += CONSOLE_MESSAGE_SPACING;
00935  }
00936 }
00937 
00938 // removes all console messages
00939 void CVideoDriver::DeleteConsoleMsgs(void)
00940 {
00941  NumConsoleMessages = 0;
00942 }
00943 
00944 // adds a console msg to the top of the screen and scrolls any
00945 // other existing messages downwards
00946 void CVideoDriver::AddConsoleMsg(const char *the_msg)
00947 {
00948  int i;
00949  for(i=MAX_CONSOLE_MESSAGES-2;i>=0;i--)
00950  {
00951   strcpy(cmsg[i+1].msg, cmsg[i].msg);
00952  }
00953  strcpy(cmsg[0].msg, the_msg);
00954 
00955  if (NumConsoleMessages < MAX_CONSOLE_MESSAGES) NumConsoleMessages++;
00956  ConsoleExpireTimer = CONSOLE_EXPIRE_RATE;
00957 }
00958 
00959 void CVideoDriver::saveCameraBounds(const st_camera_bounds &CameraBounds)
00960 {
00961  int i;
00962  int left = CameraBounds.left;
00963  int up = CameraBounds.up;
00964  int right = CameraBounds.right;
00965  int down = CameraBounds.down;
00966  int speed = CameraBounds.speed;
00967  if(left>right)
00968  {
00969   i = left-right;
00970   i = i/2;
00971   left = left-i;
00972   right = right+i;
00973   if(left>right)
00974    left = left-1;
00975  }
00976  if(up>down)
00977  {
00978   i = up-down;
00979   i = i/2;
00980   up = up-i;
00981   down = down+i;
00982   if(up>down)
00983    up = up-1;
00984  }
00985  bool invalid_value = (left<50) || (up<50) || (right<50) || (down<50) || (speed<1) || (left>270) || (up>150) || (right>270) || (down>150) || (speed>50);
00986  if(invalid_value)
00987  {
00988   m_CameraBounds.left = 152;
00989   m_CameraBounds.up = 92;
00990   m_CameraBounds.right = 168;
00991   m_CameraBounds.down = 108;
00992   m_CameraBounds.speed = 20;
00993  }
00994  else
00995  {
00996   m_CameraBounds.left = left;
00997   m_CameraBounds.up = up;
00998   m_CameraBounds.right = right;
00999   m_CameraBounds.down = down;
01000   m_CameraBounds.speed = speed;
01001  }
01002 }

01007  Fullscreen = value;

01010 short CVideoDriver::getFiltermode(void)
01011 {
01012  if(m_ScaleXFilter < 1)
01013   m_ScaleXFilter = 1;
01014  return m_ScaleXFilter;
01015 }
